docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: This document is intended as a guide for developers creating xApps for the dRAX platform, using the xApp Framework 4.0.

docs.title: Supported Versions
docs.text: This version of the xApp Framework supports RIC 7.0 and up.

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
dRAX is Accelleran’s O-RAN aligned Cloud Native RAN platform. dRAX is cloud native by design and encompasses the O-RAN defined CU function, a Service Management and Orchestration (SMO) layer, as well as a near real-time RAN Intelligent Controller (RIC) platform. It features a micro-service oriented architecture with containerized functions orchestrated via Kubernetes and supports both 4G and 5G technologies.

The dRAX RIC platform is a Near Real-Time platform. It allows developers to implement xApps that can leverage dRAX near real-time open RAN data and communicate with other xApps to bring new services and functionalities. It offers seamless integration with other orchestration platforms and lowers the technology barrier to implement Enterprise cellular networks by implementing artificial intelligence techniques for the configuration and operation of private cellular networks. This document serves as the developers guide in creating and deploying xApps on the Accelleran dRAX.

To make the development and integration of xApps into dRAX as smooth as possible, we have created the dRAX xApp Framework. This framework consists of a number of predefined and pre-developed resources that can communicate with the rest of the entities within the dRAX RIC. This allows the framework to seamlessly integrate with dRAX on deployment. Using abstractions of the lower level details, the xApp Framework exposes easy to use methods which allows the developers to only focus on the functionality of their xApp.

The dRAX xApp Framework consists of the following components, which are shown below:

  1. The xApp Library - a Python library which interfaces with the dRAX RIC platform
  2. The xApp Database - Redis server for storage of configuration data
  3. The xApp Core - the core logic of the xApp written by the developer
  4. The xApp Helm Chart - a Helm Chart used to deploy the xApp and integrate it with dRAX RIC

docs.title: Added
docs.text:
• E2 Support:
  • ORAN E2AP v2.03.
  • ORAN E2SM v2.01.
  • ORAN E2SM-CCC v3.00.

  • ORAN E2SM-RC v4.00.

  • New E2 Examples:

  • In these we demonstrate how an xApp can:

    • Create an E2 CCC subscription request, followed by a control request message to trigger a cell shutdown and cell unlock.
    • Create an E2 RC subscription request, followed by a control request message for cell barring and traffic steering.

  • Support:

  • Added compatibility for dRAX E2 broker version 6.0.0.

docs.title: Changed
docs.text:
• Simplified E2 Message Creation:
  • Improved user experience for creating E2 messages.

  • Now, users can provide a JSON message containing the complete E2 message structure as input, which is then used to generate a protobuf-encoded E2 message sent to the E2 broker.

  • Updated E2SM KPM Subscription Example:

  • Refined the approach for creating the E2SM KPM subscription example for easier use and better clarity.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • The process for obtaining the xApp library code has been updated. Refer to the Download the xApp Framework Source Code section for the latest instructions.

docs.title: Heartbeats
docs.text:
Description : Both the Layer 2 and Layer3 of each cell send out heartbeats to report that they are alive.

The Layer 2 heartbeats has the following format:

Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :**accelleran.drax.4g.ric.raw.service_discovery `

{
  "ENB": <string>,
  "ueDraxId": <string>,
  "ueRicId": <string>,
  "EnbL2ServiceHeartbeat": {
    "HeartbeatInfo": {
      "ComponentId": <string>,
      "DatastoreAvailable": <bool>,
      "Interval": <uint>
    }
  },
  "tlpublishTime__": <uint>,
  "timestamp": <int>
}

The Layer 3 heartbeats have a similar format:

Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :**accelleran.drax.4g.ric.raw.service_discovery `

{
  "ENB": <string>,
  "ueDraxId": <string>,
  "ueRicId": <string>,
  "EnbL3ServiceHeartbeat": {
    "HeartbeatInfo": {
      "ComponentId": <string>,
      "DatastoreAvailable": <bool>,
      "Interval": <uint>
    }
  },
  "tlpublishTime__": <uint>,
  "timestamp": <int>
}

docs.title: Network state
docs.text:
Description : This message publishes the network state of the eNodeB, cell and UEs connected to the cell.

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.4g.ric.raw.network_state

{
  "configurationState": {
    "items": {
      "enb-id": "<uint32>",
      "local-cell-id": "<uint32>",
      "tracking-area-code": "<uint16>",
      "cell-id": "<uint32>",
      "good-one-pps-required": "<bool>",
      "admin-state": "<AdminState>",
      "op-state": "<OpState>",
      "rf-tx-status": "<RfTxStatus>",
      "physical-cell-id": "<uint16>",
      "downlink-earfcn": "<uint16>",
      "downlink-bandwidth": "<uint8>",
      "reference-signal-power": "<int8>",
      "frequency-band-indicator": "<FrequencyBandIndicator>",
      "prach-root-sequence-index": "<uint16>",
      "plmn-list": [
        "<string>",
      ],
      "mme-set-list": [
        "<string64>",
      ],
      "serial-number": "<string64>",
      "gnss-status": "<GnssStatus",
      "longitude": "<int32>",
      "latitude": "<int32>",
      "altitude": "<int32>"
    },
    "ueState": {
      "items": {
        "inRange": {
          "items": <uint64>
        },
        "servingCell": "<string>",
        "timestamp": <uint64>
      }
    }
  }
}

Enumeration description : 

Enum Type:
AdminState

Enum Values:
locked
unlocked

Enum Type:
OpState

Enum Values:
enabled
disabled

Enum Type:
RfTxStatus

Enum Values:
on-air
off-air

Enum Type:
FrequencyBandIndicator

Enum Values:
band-3
band-7
band-14
band-38
band-40
band-42
band-43
band-48

Enum Type:
GnssStatus

Enum Values:
not-yet-available
available

docs.title: UE Measurements
docs.text:
Description : If periodic reporting is enabled in the 4G Radio Controller, the UEs will be instructed to send periodic measurements. These measurements contain the RSRP and RSRQ value from the UE to its serving cell, as well as a maximum of 8 neighbouring cells. Each measurement to a specific cell is sent as a separate message.

Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :**accelleran.drax.4g.ric.raw.ue_measurements `

{
  "ENB": <string>,
  "CELL": <string>,
  "UE": <string>,
  "ueDraxId": <string>,
  "ueRicId": <string>,
  "Rc4gUeMeasurement": {
    "UniqueRicId": <string>,
    "CellId": <string>,
    "AttachedCellId": <string>,
    "Rsrp": <uint>,
    "Rsrq": <uint>,
    "EllipsoidPointR10": {
      "EncodedAsn1Length": <uint>,
      "EncodedAsn1Body": <bytes>
    },
    "EllipsoidPointWithAltitudeR10": {
      "EncodedAsn1Length": <uint>,
      "EncodedAsn1Body": <bytes>
    },
    "HorizontalVelocityR10": {
      "EncodedAsn1Length": <uint>,
      "EncodedAsn1Body": <bytes>
    },
    "GnssTodMsecR10": {
      "EncodedAsn1Length": <uint>,
      "EncodedAsn1Body": <bytes>
    }
  },
  "tlpublishTime__": <uint>,
  "timestamp": <int>
}

docs.title: L2 Stats
docs.text:
Description : The dRAX RIC also reports the downlink and uplink L2 stats of the UEs in the network.

Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :**accelleran.drax.4g.ric.raw.ue_measurements `

{
  "ENB": <string>,
  "CELL": <string>,
  "UE": <string>,
  "ueDraxId": <string>,
  "ueRicId": <string>,
  "EnbStatsL2StatsValues": {
    "Report": {
      "DschThroughput": <uint>,
      "UschThroughput": <uint>,
      "DownlinkBler": <uint>,
      "UplinkBler": <uint>,
      "TimingAdvance": <uint>,
      "UlSinr": <uint>
    }
  },
  "tlpublishTime__": <uint>,
  "timestamp": <int>
}

docs.title: CQI
docs.text:
Description : The dRAX RIC also supports retrieving the CQI report of the UE to its serving cell. You can get the CQI value from each subband as well as the wideband CQI value.

Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :**accelleran.drax.4g.ric.raw.ue_measurements `

{
  "ENB": <string>,
  "CELL": <string>,
  "UE": <string>,
  "ueDraxId": <string>,
  "ueRicId": <string>,
  "EnbStatsCqiReportValues": {
    "Report": {
      "WidebandCqi": <uint>,
      "CodeblockId": <uint>,
      "CqiList": {
        "0": <uint>
      },
      "CqiListSize": <uint>,
      "RankIndication": <uint>,
      "TransmissionMode": <uint>,
      "UeEdge": <uint>
    }
  },
  "tlpublishTime__": <uint>,
  "timestamp": <int>
}

docs.title: DU beacon info
docs.text:
Description : This message gives information about the DUs connected to the CU-CP and their operational state (including [3GPP 38.473] served cell information).

Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :**accelleran.drax.5g.ric.raw.cu_state `

{
  "DuBeaconInfo":  {
    "DuList":  {
      "items":  {
        "0": {
          "GnbDuId":  <uint>,
          "State":  "<DuState>",
          "ServedCellList":  {
            "items":  {
              "0": {
                "State":  "<CellState>",
                "NrCgi":  {
                  "NrCellId":  <uint>,
                  "PlmnId":  {
                    "Data":  {
                      "0": <uint>
                    }
                  }
                },
                "Pci":  <uint>,
                "FivegSTac":  <string>,
                "SsPBCHBlockPower":  <int>,
                "SupportedPlmns":  {
                  "items":  {
                    "0": {
                      "PlmnIdentity":  <string>,
                      "TaiSlicedSupportList":  {
                        "items":  {
                          "0": {
                            "SNssai":  {
                              "SST":  <uint>,
                              "SD":  {
                                "Data":  {
                                  "0": <uint>
                                }
                              }
                            }
                          }
                        }
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          },
          "GnbId":  <uint>,
          "DuName":  <string>,
          "TransportLayerAddress":  <string>
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "tlpublishTime__":  <uint>,
  "spanContext__":  <bytes>
}

Enumeration description : 

Enum Type:
DuState

Enum Values:
NON_OPERATIONAL
NON_OPERATIONAL_FAILURE
OPERATIONAL

Enum Type:
CellState

Enum Values:
NOT_SUPPORTED
ACTIVATING
DEACTIVATING
RESOURCE_UNAVAIL
ACTIVATION_FAILED
ACTIVATED

    "CucpId":  <uint>,
    "State":  "<CucpState>",
    "ServedPlmns":  {
      "items":  {
        "0": {
          "PlmnIdentity":  {
            "Data":  {
              "0": <uint>
            }
          },
          "TaiSlicedSupportList":  {
            "items":  {
              "0": {
                "SNssai":  {
                  "SST":  <uint>,
                  "SD":  {
                    "Data":  {
                      "0": <uint>
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "AdminState":  "<AdminState>",
    "NatsUrl":  <string>,
    "RedisIp":  <string>,
    "RedisPort":  <uint>,
    "Version":  <string>,
    "ExtraInfoList":  {
      "items":  {
        "0": {
          "Name":  <string>,
          "Value":  <string>
        }
      }
    },
    "GnbIdLength":  <uint>,
    "AmfList":  {
      "items":  {
        "0": {
          "AmfName":  <string>,
          "State":  "<AmfState>",
          "AmfIpaddress":  <string>,
          "SupportedPlmns":  {
            "items":  {
              "0": {
                "PlmnIdentity":  {
                  "Data":  {
                    "0": <uint>
                  }
                },
                "SliceSupportList":  {
                  "items":  {
                    "0": {
                      "SNssai":  {
                        "SST":  <uint>,
                        "SD":  {
                          "Data":  {
                            "0": <uint>
                          }
                        }
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          },
          "AmfGuid":  <string>
        }
      }
    },
    "CuCpName":  <string>

  "tlpublishTime__":  <uint>,

Enum Type:
CucpState

docs.title: UE Measurements
docs.text:
Description : These measurements contain the RSRP and RSRQ periodic measurements from serving cell.

Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :**accelleran.drax.5g.ric.raw.ue_measurements `

{
  "ENB":  <string>,
  "DU":  <string>,
  "CELL":  <string>,
  "UE":  <string>,
  "RrcMeasurementReportResultInfo":  {
    "GnbCuCpUeId":  <uint>,
    "Timestamp":  <uint>,
    "ServingCellInfo":  {
      "NrCgi":  {
        "NrCellId":  <uint>,
        "PlmnId":  {
          "Data":  {
            "0": <uint>
          }
        }
      },
      "SsbRsrpResult":  <uint>,
      "SsbRsrpResultPresent":  <bool>,
      "SsbRsrqResult":  <uint>,
      "SsbRsrqResultPresent":  <bool>,
      "SsbSinrResult":  <uint>,
      "SsbSinrResultPresent":  <bool>
    },
    "NumberOfIncludedCells":  <uint>,
    "CellInfo":  {
      "0": {
        "PhyCellId":  <uint>,
        "NeighbourCellInfo":  {
          "NrCgi":  {
            "NrCellId":  <uint>,
            "PlmnId":  {
              "Data":  {
                "0": <uint>
              }
            }
          },
          "SsbRsrpResult":  <uint>,
          "SsbRsrpResultPresent":  <bool>,
          "SsbRsrqResult":  <uint>,
          "SsbRsrqResultPresent":  <bool>,
          "SsbSinrResult":  <uint>,
          "SsbSinrResultPresent":  <bool>
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "tlpublishTime__":  <uint>,
  "spanContext__":  <bytes>
}

docs.title: CU Attempted RRC Connection Establishments
docs.text:
Description : Receipt of an RRCSetupRequest message by the gNB from the UE.

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

{
    "PmCounterReport": {
        "InstanceId": "<string>", // NRCGI converted to string
        "CounterId": "<string>",  // Sub Counter with relevant establishment cause
        "InstanceType": "CELL_TYPE",
        "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>",
        "CounterValue": "<uint32>",
        "CounterGroup": "RRC_CONNECTION_EST_ATTEMPT"
    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: CU DL GTP Throughput
docs.text:
Description : Measure of DL GTP data received during the reporting period in the observed cell. Data for all UEs (all PDU sessions) in a cell is aggregated. The reported DL_GTP_THP counter instance indicates total throughput and total samples (incremented one per second when the pdu session is active) for a UE

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

{
    "PmCounterReport": {

docs.title: CU UL GTP Throughput
docs.text:
Description : Measure of UL GTP data received during the reporting period in the observed cell. Data for all UEs (all PDU sessions) in a cell is aggregated. The reported UL_GTP_THP counter instance indicates total throughput and total samples (incremented one per second when the pdu session is active) for a UE

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

{
    "PmCounterReport": {
        "InstanceId": "<string>", //CU-CP UE ID
        "CounterId": "UL_GTP_THP",
        "InstanceType": "UE_TYPE",
        "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>",
        "CounterValue": "<float32>",  // THP value bytes per sec
        "CUCP_UE_ID": "<string>", //CU-CP UE ID
    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: CU Maximum number of RRC Connections
docs.text:
Description : Maximum number of users in RRC connected mode during each granularity period

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

        "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>",
        "CounterValue": "<uint32>",
    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: CU UL PDCP SDU loss rate (QOS)
docs.text:
Description : The fraction of PDCP SDU packets which are not successfully received at gNB-CU-UP. 1000000* Number of missing UL PDCP SNs of a DRB, divided by Total number of UL PDCP SNs. This value represents packets that are not delivered to higher layers.

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

{
    "PmCounterReport": {
        "InstanceId": "<string>", // QFI
        "CounterId": "DRB_PACKET_LOSS_UL_QOS",
        "InstanceType": "QOS_TYPE",
        "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>",
        "CounterValue": "<uint32>",
        "QFI": "<string>",
        "CU_CP_UE_ID": "<uint32>", //CU-CP UE ID
    },
    "timestamp":  <uint64>
}

docs.title: CU UL PDCP SDU loss rate (S-NSSAI)
docs.text:
Description : The fraction of PDCP SDU packets which are not successfully received at gNB-CU-UP. 1000000* Number of missing UL PDCP SNs of a DRB, divided by Total number of UL PDCP SNs. This value represents packets that are not delivered to higher layers.

{

        "CounterValue": "<uint32>",
        "SST": "<uint32>", // S-NSSAI SST
        "SD": "<uint32>"   // S-NSSAI SD
    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: CU DL PDCP SDU drop rate (QOS)
docs.text:
Description : The fraction of PDCP SDU packets which are dropped on the downlink, due to high traffic load, traffic management etc. 1000000*Number of DL packets, for which no part has been transmitted over the F1-U or Xn-U or X2-U interface, of a data radio bearer, that are discarded in the PDCP layer, divided by Number of DL packets for data radio bearers that has entered PDCP upper SAP.

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

{
    "PmCounterReport": {
        "InstanceId": "<string>", // QFI
        "CounterId": "DRB_PDCP_PACKET_DROP_RATE_DL_QOS",
        "InstanceType": "QOS_TYPE",
        "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>",
        "CounterValue": "<uint32>",
        "QFI": "<string>",
        "CU_CP_UE_ID": "<uint32>" //CU-CP UE ID
    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.text:
Description : The fraction of PDCP SDU packets which are dropped on the downlink, due to high traffic load, traffic management etc. 1000000*Number of DL packets, for which no part has been transmitted over the F1-U or Xn-U or X2-U interface, of a data radio bearer, that are discarded in the PDCP layer, divided by Number of DL packets for data radio bearers that has entered PDCP upper SAP.

        "SST": "<uint32>", // S-NSSAI SST

    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: CU Packet Delay: Average delay DL in CU-UP (QOS)
docs.text:
Description : The average (arithmetic mean) PDCP SDU delay on the downlink within the gNB-CU-UP for all PDCP packets. Sum of (time when sending a PDCP SDU to the gNB-DU at the egress PDCP layer on F1-U/Xn-U, minus time of arrival of the same packet at NG-U ingress IP termination) divided by total number of PDCP SDUs arriving at NG-U ingress IP termination

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

{
    "PmCounterReport": {
        "InstanceId": "<string>",
        "CounterId": "AVERAGE_DELAY_DL_IN_CUUP_QOS",
        "InstanceType": "NONE_TYPE",
        "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>",
        "CounterValue": "<uint32>", //Mean Delay in 0.1 millisecond
        "QFI": "<uint32>"
    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: CU Packet Delay: Average delay DL in CU-UP (S-NSSAI)
docs.text:
Description : The average (arithmetic mean) PDCP SDU delay on the downlink within the gNB-CU-UP for all PDCP packets. Sum of (time when sending a PDCP SDU to the gNB-DU at the egress PDCP layer on F1-U/Xn-U, minus time of arrival of the same packet at NG-U ingress IP termination) divided by total number of PDCP SDUs arriving at NG-U ingress IP termination

    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: CU SS RSRP Distribution per SSB
docs.text:
Description : This measurement provides the distribution of SS-RSRP per SSB (see TS 38.215) received by gNB from UEs in the cell when SS-RSRP is used for L1-RSRP as configured by reporting configurations as defined in TS 38.214, in case the L1-RSRP report function is enabled.

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

Reported RSRP value (range 0..127) Measured quantity value (L1 SS-RSRP) Bin0 127 >= -30 dBm Bin1 126..107 -31 dBm to -50dBm Bin2 106..87 -51 dBm to -70dBm Bin3 86..67 -71 dBm to -90 dBm Bin4 66..47 -91 dBm to -110 dBm Bin5 46..27 -111 dBm to -130 dBm Bin6 26..7 -131 dBm to -150 dBm Bin7 6..0 <= -150 dBm 
{
    "PmCounterReport": {
        "InstanceId": "<string>", // ssb frequency
        "CounterId": "SS_RSRP_DISTRIBUTION_PER_SSB",
        "InstanceType": "SSB_FREQ_TYPE",
        "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>",
        "CounterValue": "<uint32>", // count
        "bin": "<uint32>", // bin
        "ssb": "<string>", //ssb frequency
    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: CU Packet Delay: Distribution of delay DL in CU-UP (QOS)
docs.text:
Description : The distribution of PDCP SDU delay on the downlink within the gNB-CU-UP, for all PDCP packets (time when sending a PDCP SDU to the gNB-DU at the egress PDCP layer on F1-U/Xn-U, minus time of arrival of the same packet at NG-U ingress IP termination) distributed in following bins

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

Bin Value bin0 <= 5ms bin1 6ms to 10ms bin2 11ms to 20ms bin3 21ms to 30ms .. bin10 91ms to 100ms bin11 101ms to 200ms bin12 201ms to 300ms .. bin19 901ms to 1000ms bin20 >1s to <=2s bin21 >2s to <=3s bin22 >3s to <=4s bin23 >4s to <=5s bin24 > 5s 
{

        "InstanceId": "<string>", // QFI

        "InstanceType": "QOS_TYPE",
        "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>",
        "CounterValue": "<uint32>",
        "bin": "<uint32>",
        "QFI": "<string>"
    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: E1LinkPolicy
docs.text:
Groups parameters that define the policy relating to the use of E1 links.

Field Type Label Description SctpPolicy SctpPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy for the use of SCTP on E1 links.

docs.title: F1CLinkPolicy
docs.text:
Groups parameters that define the policy relating to the use of F1-c links.

Field Type Label Description SctpPolicy SctpPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy for the use of SCTP on F1-c links.

docs.title: NgCLinkPolicy
docs.text:
Groups parameters that define the policy relating to the use of NG-C links.

Field Type Label Description SctpPolicy SctpPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy for the use of SCTP on NG-C links.

docs.title: NrCellGlobalIdentity
docs.text: Field Type Label Description PlmnIdentity string optional NrCellIdentity uint64 optional

docs.title: ReportPollingConfig
docs.text: Field Type Label Description TimerEnabled bool optional PduWithoutPollCountEnabled bool optional Timer uint32 optional NumPduWithoutPoll uint32 optional

docs.title: SNssai
docs.text: Field Type Label Description Sst Sst optional Slice/Service Type. Sd uint32 optional Slice Differentiator.

docs.title: SctpPolicy
docs.text: Field Type Label Description InStreams uint32 optional The maximum number of inbound streams that will be accepted. OutStreams uint32 optional The number of outbound streams that will be requested.

docs.title: SsbMtc
docs.text: Field Type Label Description SmtcPeriodicity SsbMtcPeriodicity optional SmtcOffset uint32 optional SSB transmission offset in subframes Duration uint32 optional

docs.title: SupportedPlmnSlices
docs.text:
Groups information about a PLMN and the set of slices supported by that PLMN.

Field Type Label Description PlmnId string optional Identifies a PLMN. NbrOfSNssai uint32 optional automatically added field for "s-nssai" list SNssai SNssai repeated Identifies a slice that is supported by the PLMN.

docs.title: CellReselectionSubPriority
docs.text:
indicates a fractional value to be added to the value of cellReselectionPriority to obtain the absolute priority of the concerned carrier frequency for E-UTRA and NR

Name Number Description o_2 0 0.2 o_4 1 0.4 o_6 2 0.6 o_8 3 0.8

docs.title: CipheringAlgorithm
docs.text:
Type definition for 5G ciphering algorithms.

Name Number Description nea0 0 NEA0, the null 5G ciphering algorithm. nea1 1 128-NEA1, the 128-bit SNOW 3G based 5G ciphering algorithm. nea2 2 128-NEA2, the 128-bit AES based 5G ciphering algorithm. nea3 3 128-NEA3, the 128-bit ZUC based 5G ciphering algorithm.

The values mbw6, mbw15, mbw25, mbw50, mbw75, mbw100 indicate 6, 15, 25, 50, 75 and 100 resource blocks, respectively

docs.title: AdminState
docs.text:
Administrative state of a managed object. The value locked means that the managed object is not allowed to operate. The value ulocked means that the managed object is allowed to operate.

Name Number Description Locked 0 UnLocked 1

docs.title: OpState
docs.text:
Operational state of a managed object. The value enabled means that the managed object is capable of operating normally. The value disabled means that the managed object is not capable of operating normally (e.g. due to a fault condition).

Name Number Description Enabled 0 Disabled 1

docs.title: RfTxStatus

docs.title: ReportConfigA3
docs.text:
Defines parameters that are configurable for all A3 report configurations (other than those in report-config-common).

Field Type Label Description A3Offset int32 optional The offset value to be used in an A3 report configuration. TriggerQuantity TriggerQuantity optional Indicates whether A3 is to be based on RSRP or RSRQ or SINR measurements. Hysteresis uint32 optional The hysteresis parameter used in the entering and leaving conditions for an A3 event triggered reporting condition. TimeToTrigger TimeToTrigger optional The time during which the conditions for an A3 event need to be met in order to trigger a measurement report.

docs.title: ReportConfigCommon
docs.text:
Defines parameters that are configurable for all reportConfigs.

Field Type Label Description MaxReportCells uint32 optional The maximum number of neighbour cells to be reported in the Measurement Report message. ReportInterval ReportInterval optional The interval between periodic reports. Can be applied to triggerType 'event' as well as 'periodical'. ReportAmount ReportAmount optional The number of measurement reports required. Can be applied to triggerType 'event' as well as 'periodical'. FilterCoeffRsrp PBAcc5GTypes.FilterCoefficient optional Filter coefficient for RSRP measurements at the UE FilterCoeffRsrq PBAcc5GTypes.FilterCoefficient optional Filter coefficient for RSRQ measurements at the UE FilterCoeffSinr PBAcc5GTypes.FilterCoefficient optional Filter coefficient for SINR measurements at the UE

docs.title: RegistrationRequestObject
docs.text: Field Type Label Description UserId string optional The UR-ID per [n.12] R2-SRR-02 conformant per section 2.2 of [n.18]. FccId string optional The FCC certification identifier of the CBSD. It is a string of up to 19 characters as described in [n.22] CbsdSerialNumber string optional A serial number assigned to the CBSD by the CBSD device manufacturer having a maximum length of 64 octets. This serial number shall be unique for every CBSD instance sharing the same value of fccId. Each CBSD has a single CBSD Antenna (Ref. definition in section 4) and has a single cbsdSerialNumber. CallSign string optional A device identifier provided by the FCC per [n.13]. CbsdCategory CbsdCategory optional Device Category of the CBSD. Allowed values are 'A' or 'B' as defined in Part 96 CbsdInfo CbsdInfo optional Information about this CBSD model. AirInterface AirInterfaceObject optional A data object that includes information on the air interface technology of the CBSD. InstallationParam InstallationParamObject optional A data object that includes information on CBSD installation. MeasurementCapabilities MeasurementCapabilitiesObject optional The array of string lists measurement reporting capabilities of the CBSD. The permitted enumerations are specified in [n.21]. GroupingParam GroupingParam optional An array of data objects that includes information on CBSD grouping. CpiSignatureData CpiSignatureData optional The CPI is vouching for the parameters included in this object. In addition, the digital signature for these parameters is included.

docs.title: CbrsClientConfiguration
docs.text: Field Type Label Description CbrsActivated bool optional If true the client can start its procedures to SAS server,if false it will relinquish all leases and deregister CbrsAdminState PBcbrstypes.SasAdminState optional SasServerUrl string optional The URL of the SAS server or the domain proxy VerboseHttp bool optional If this is set to true, all http traffic will we logged, only use for debug purposes NrCellGlobalIdentity PBcbrstypes.NrCellGlobalIdentity optional DesiredBandwidths DesiredBandwidthList optional GrantConfig CbrsClientGrantConfiguration optional TimersConfig CbrsClientTimersConfig optional RetryConfig CbrsClientRetryConfiguration optional Frequency_ranges PBCbsdCodecs.FrequencyRangeObject optional

docs.title: CbrsClientGrantConfiguration
docs.text: Field Type Label Description NumberOfParallelGrants uint32 optional GrantRenewalAdvanceTime uint32 optional If the grantExpireTime grant-renewal-time is in the past, the next heartbeat request will set the grantRenewalTime to True

docs.title: CbrsClientRetryConfiguration
docs.text: Field Type Label Description MaxRegegistrationAttempts uint32 optional maximum number of registration attempts before entering fatal state MaxSpectrumInquiryAttempts uint32 optional maximum number of spectrum inquiry attempts before entering fatal state MaxRelinquishmentAttempts uint32 optional maximum number of relinquishment attempts before entering fatal state MaxDeregistrationAttempts uint32 optional maximum number of deregistration attempts before entering fatal state

docs.title: CbrsClientTimersConfig
docs.text: Field Type Label Description SpectrumInfoExpiration uint32 optional Time in seconds a Spectrum inquiry response is valid. If not set or if zero it is valid for ever NoAvailbleChannelsRetry uint32 optional Time in seconds a Spectrum inquiry will to send out a new request if the latest response did not return channels DeregistrationTimeout uint32 optional Time in seconds a deregistration procedure can last RelinquishmentTimeout uint32 optional Time in seconds a relinquishment procedure can last RegistrationPendingRetry uint32 optional Time in seconds we will wait before we retry registration request after receing a reg_pending response SpectrumInquiryRetry uint32 optional Time in seconds we will wait before we retry spectrum inquiry request after receiving a server error HttpTimeout uint32 optional Time in seconds an HTTP request can last

docs.title: SasAdminState
docs.text:
Administrative state. Value 'unlocked' means that the SAS client is permitted send CBSD-SAS spectrum inquiry, grant requests and heart beat requests. Value 'locked' means that the CU-CP relinquishes the grant and stays in CBSD registered state.

Name Number Description Locked 0 Unlocked 1

docs.title: ConnectedAmf
docs.text:
Represents an AMF, as seen from the gNB-CU-CP.

Field Type Label Description AmfName string optional The AMF Name that is received from the AMF over NG-C. IpAddress string optional State PBFivegBeaconInfoData.AmfState optional RelativeAmfCapacity uint32 optional Relative AMF Capacity NbrOfServedGuami uint32 optional automatically added field for "served-guami" list ServedGuami ServedGuami repeated Contains a list of served GUAMI as received from the AMF over NG-C. NbrOfSupportedPlmnSlices uint32 optional automatically added field for "supported-plmn-slices" list SupportedPlmnSlices PBAcc5GTypes.SupportedPlmnSlices repeated Identifies a PLMN and the slice(s) it supports.

docs.title: ServedGuami
docs.text:
Groups data relating to a served GUAMI.

Field Type Label Description PlmnIdentity string optional Identifies the PLMN to which the AMF belongs. AmfRegionId uint32 optional AMF Region ID. AmfSetId uint32 optional AMF Set ID. Uniquely identifies the AMF Set within the AMF Region. AmfPointer uint32 optional AMF Pointer. Identifies one or more AMFs within the AMF set. BackupAmfName string optional The backup AMF Name that is received from the AMF over NG-C.

docs.title: ConnectedGnbDu
docs.text:
Represents a gNB-CU-UP, as seen from the gNB-CU-CP.

Field Type Label Description GnbDuId uint64 optional The gNB-DU ID that is received from the gNB-DU over F1-C. GnbDuName string optional The gNB-DU Name that is received from the gNB-DU over F1-C. NbrOfServedCell uint32 optional automatically added field for "served-cell" list ServedCell ServedCell repeated Identifies a served cell, its PLMN(s) and the slice(s) they support.

NbrOfServedPlmnSlices uint32 optional automatically added field for "served-plmn-slices" list ServedPlmnSlices PBAcc5GTypes.SupportedPlmnSlices repeated Identifies a PLMN and the slice(s) it supports.

docs.title: PduSessionCreateInfo
docs.text:
Contains information to create/delete a GTP tunnel for benchmark puropses

Field Type Label Description PduSessionId uint32 optional The PDU Session will be created. Currently a PDU session can have only 1 tunnel TunnelId uint32 optional The tunnelId that will be created. Please not that MSB (most significant bit of the tunnel-id MUST be 0. It will be ignored anyway SimulatedDuIpAddress string optional The IPv4 address in dotted notation of the process that simulates the DU (downlink) SimulatedUpfIpAddress string optional The IPv4 address in dotted notation of the process that simulates the UPS (uplink)

docs.title: PduSessionTeardownInfo
docs.text:
Contains information to create/delete a GTP tunnel for benchmark puropses

Field Type Label Description PduSessionId uint32 optional The pduSessionId that will be deleted. TunnelId uint32 optional The tunnelId that will be deleted. Please not that MSB (most significant bit of the tunnel-id MUST be 0. It will be ignored anyway

Publisher : DataChangedPublisher

Description : This publisher will publish a list of XPATHS that were modified

Field Type Label Description XpathList XpathList optional See XpathList for detailed description of this field tlpublishTime__ uint64 optional Contains the time of publishing in EPOCH milliseconds spanContext__ bytes optional Contains an opentracing spancontext

docs.title: XpathItem
docs.text: Field Type Label Description Xpath string optional LeafName string optional Operation Operation optional Origin Origin optional

docs.title: XpathList
docs.text: Field Type Label Description items XpathItem repeated Carries max MAX_NUM_OF_XPATHS elements of type XpathItem

docs.title: FilterModeType
docs.text:
Specifies how you want filterinf done

Name Number Description Filter_PREFIX 0 If the XPATH matches the beginning the filter will pass Filter_FULL 1 The XPATH must match exactly in order to pass Filter_LEAF 2 The XPATH must match exactly and the leaf must be matching in order to pass Filter_PREFIX_IGNORE_KEYS 3 If the XPATH matches the beginning the filter will pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes) Filter_FULL_IGNORE_KEYS 4 The XPATH must match exactly in order to pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes) Filter_LEAF_IGNORE_KEYS 5 The XPATH must match exactly and the leaf must be matching in order to pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes)

docs.title: Operation
docs.text:
Specifies what happend (Create Update Delete)

Name Number Description Operation_UNKNOWN 0 The operation could not be determined Operation_CREATE 1 A create was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_UPDATE 2 An update was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_DELETE 3 A delete was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_ALL 4 value to indicate that all operations are good

docs.title: Origin
docs.text:
Specifies where the modification came from

Name Number Description Origin_APP 0 Modification was done by the application Origin_NETCONF 1 Modification was done via NetConf

Contains the configuration for RIC based UE/PDU session admission control

docs.title: GnbCuCp
docs.text:
Grouping for the class representing a gNB-CU-CP.

Field Type Label Description GnbId uint32 optional The gNB ID part of the Global gNB ID. PlmnId string optional 5 or 6 digit PLMN code (MCC and MNC) of the PLMN to which the gNB belongs. Forms part of the gNB's Global gNB ID as used in NGAP messages. GnbIdLength uint32 optional The length of the bit string representation of the gNB ID. GnbCuCpName string optional Human readable name of the gNB-CU-CP. If configured, this is sent to a gNB-CU-UP, gNB-DU and AMF during the E1, F1 and NG Setup procedures respectively. AdminState PBAccGenTypes.AdminState optional Administrative state. Value 'unlocked' means that the gNB is permitted to serve users. Value 'locked' means that the gNB is prohibited from serving users. In the 'locked' state, all of the gNB's cells will be off air. RlcMode PBAcc5GTypes.RlcMode optional Contains RLC mode entity value. OpState PBAccGenTypes.OpState optional Operational state. Value 'disabled' means that the gNB is totally inoperable and unable to provide service to users. Value 'enabled' means that the gNB is partially or fully operable and available for use. NbrOfAllowedCipheringAlgorithm uint32 optional automatically added field for "allowed-ciphering-algorithm" list AllowedCipheringAlgorithm PBAcc5GTypes.CipheringAlgorithm repeated List of 5G ciphering algorithms allowed to be used in the gNB, in decreasing order of preference, i.e. most preferred algorithm first. If nea0 is included, it should be the last entry in the list. Ciphering algorithms that are not supported by the gNB must not be included in the list. NbrOfAllowedIntegrityAlgorithm uint32 optional automatically added field for "allowed-integrity-algorithm" list AllowedIntegrityAlgorithm PBAcc5GTypes.IntegrityAlgorithm repeated List of 5G integrity algorithms allowed to be used in the gNB, in decreasing order of preference, i.e. most preferred algorithm first. nia0 should only be included in deployments where support of unauthenticated emergency calling is a regulatory requirement, and should be the last entry in the list. Integrity algorithms that are not supported by the gNB must not be included in the list. E1LinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.E1LinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of SCTP on E1 interfaces. F1CLinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.F1CLinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of SCTP on F1-c interfaces. NbrOfOperator uint32 optional automatically added field for "operator" list Operator Operator repeated Data relating to an operator who makes use of the gNB's services and resources. There may be more than one operator in the case of RAN sharing.

docs.title: HandoverControl
docs.text:
Contains the configuration for RSRP triggered A3 events used for handover control

Field Type Label Description Enabled bool optional Controls if the gNB-CU-CP configures measurement reports for handover and triggers handovers based on them. This does not affect the ability to trigger handover through external handover commands. ReportConfigA3Rsrp PBAccNrUeMeas.ReportConfigA3 optional

docs.title: NgCLink
docs.text:
Grouping for the class representing an NG-C link.

Field Type Label Description DestAddress string optional IP address or FQDN of the AMF at the far end of the link. OpState PBAccGenTypes.OpState optional Value 'enabled' means that an SCTP association has been established and an NG Setup procedure has been successfully performed with the AMF at the far end of the link; otherwise the value is 'disabled'. DefaultAmf bool optional Corresponds to default AMF as specified in [3GPP 23.501] AmfName string optional This is the value of the AMF Name received in an NGAP message from the AMF at the far end of the link.

docs.title: Operator
docs.text:
Grouping for the class representing an operator of a gNB.

Field Type Label Description OperatorId string optional A string that uniquely identifies the operator. NgCLinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.NgCLinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of NG-C links to AMFs belonging to the operator. NbrOfNgCLink uint32 optional automatically added field for "ng-c-link" list NgCLink NgCLink repeated Represents a logical link on the NG-C interface between the gNB-CU-CP and an AMF.

docs.title: GnbCuUp
docs.text:
Represents a gNB-CU-UP.

Field Type Label Description UpIntegrityProtectionEnabled bool optional Value true means that the CU-UP will activate integrity protection of DRBs if requested, subject to the specified integrity algorithm being supported; false means that it will not activate integrity protection of DRBs under any circumstances. This determines how the CU-UP handles receipt of a Security Indication IE with the Integrity Protection Indication IE set to 'required' or 'preferred', over E1. UpCipheringEnabled bool optional Value true means that the CU-UP will activate confidentiality protection of DRBs if requested, subject to the specified ciphering algorithm being supported; false means that it will not activate confidentiality protection of DRBs under any circumstances. This determines how the CU-UP handles receipt of a Security Indication IE with the Confidentiality Protection Indication IE set to 'required' or 'preferred', over E1.

docs.text:
pm counter instance types

Name Number Description NONE_TYPE 0 included information is per complete node CELL_TYPE 1 included information is per cell AMF_TYPE 2 included information is per AMF (5G cores) UE_TYPE 3 included information is per UE UE_QOS_SNSSAI_PLMN_TYPE 4 included information is per UE, QFI, S-NSSAI and PLMN-ID SSB_FREQ_TYPE 5 included information is per SSB frequency QOS_TYPE 6 included information is per QoS SNSSAI_TYPE 7 included information is per S-NSSAI QOS_SNSSAI_PLMN_TYPE 8 included information is per QFI, S-NSSAI and PLMN-ID FIVEQI_TYPE 9 included information is per 5QI INVALID_TYPE 10

docs.title: DU beacon info
docs.text:
Description : This message gives information about the DUs connected to the CU-CP and their operational state (including [3GPP 38.473] served cell information).

Kafka topic : **Kafka topic :**accelleran.drax.5g.ric.raw.cu_state `

{
  "DuBeaconInfo": {
    "DuList": {
      "items": {
        "0": {
          "GnbDuId": <uint>,
          "State": "<DuState>",
          "ServedCellList": {
            "items": {
              "0": {
                "State": "<CellState>",
                "NrCgi": {
                  "NrCellId": <uint>,
                  "PlmnId": {
                    "Data": {
                      "0": <uint>
                    }
                  }
                },
                "Pci": <uint>,
                "FivegSTac": <string>,
                "SsPBCHBlockPower": <int>,
                "SupportedPlmns": {
                  "items": {
                    "0": {
                      "PlmnIdentity": <string>,
                      "TaiSlicedSupportList": {
                        "items": {
                          "0": {
                            "SNssai": {
                              "SST": <uint>,
                              "SD": {
                                "Data": {
                                  "0": <uint>
                                }
                              }
                            }
                          }
                        }
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          },
          "GnbId": <uint>,
          "DuName": <string>,
          "TransportLayerAddress": <string>
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "tlpublishTime__": <uint>,
  "spanContext__": <bytes>
}

Enumeration description : 

Enum Type:
DuState

Enum Values:
NON_OPERATIONAL
NON_OPERATIONAL_FAILURE
OPERATIONAL

Enum Type:
CellState

Enum Values:
NOT_SUPPORTED
ACTIVATING
DEACTIVATING
RESOURCE_UNAVAIL
ACTIVATION_FAILED
ACTIVATED

docs.title: CU Number of PDU sessions requested to setup
docs.text:
Description : Number of PDU sessions requested in NGInitialContextSetupRequest/NGPDUSessionResourceSetupRequest

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

{
    "PmCounterReport": {
        "InstanceId": "<string>", // NRCGI converted to string
        "CounterId": "NUMBER_OF_PDU_SESSIONS_REQUESTED_TO_SETUP",

    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: CU DL GTP Throughput
docs.text:
Description : Measure of DL GTP data received during the reporting period in the observed cell. Data for all UEs (all PDU sessions) in a cell is aggregated. The reported DL_GTP_THP counter instance indicates total throughput and total samples (incremented one per second when the pdu session is active) for a UE

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

{
    "PmCounterReport": {
        "InstanceId": "<string>", //CU-CP UE ID
        "CounterId": "DL_GTP_THP",
        "InstanceType": "UE_TYPE",
        "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>",
        "CounterValue": "<float32>",  // THP value bytes per sec
        "CUCP_UE_ID": "<string>", //CU-CP UE ID
    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

}

docs.title: CU UL PDCP SDU loss rate (QOS)
docs.text:
Description : The fraction of PDCP SDU packets which are not successfully received at gNB-CU-UP. 1000000* Number of missing UL PDCP SNs of a DRB, divided by Total number of UL PDCP SNs. This value represents packets that are not delivered to higher layers.

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

{
    "PmCounterReport": {
        "InstanceId": "<string>", // QFI
        "CounterId": "DRB_PACKET_LOSS_UL_QOS",
        "InstanceType": "QOS_TYPE",
        "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>",
        "CounterValue": "<uint32>",
        "QFI": "<string>",
        "CU_CP_UE_ID": "<uint32>", //CU-CP UE ID
    },
    "timestamp":  <uint64>
}

    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: CU DL PDCP SDU drop rate (QOS)
docs.text:
Description : The fraction of PDCP SDU packets which are dropped on the downlink, due to high traffic load, traffic management etc. 1000000*Number of DL packets, for which no part has been transmitted over the F1-U or Xn-U or X2-U interface, of a data radio bearer, that are discarded in the PDCP layer, divided by Number of DL packets for data radio bearers that has entered PDCP upper SAP.

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

{
    "PmCounterReport": {
        "InstanceId": "<string>", // QFI
        "CounterId": "DRB_PDCP_PACKET_DROP_RATE_DL_QOS",
        "InstanceType": "QOS_TYPE",
        "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>",
        "CounterValue": "<uint32>",
        "QFI": "<string>",
        "CU_CP_UE_ID": "<uint32>" //CU-CP UE ID
    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: CU Packet Delay: Average delay DL in CU-UP (QOS)
docs.text:
Description : The average (arithmetic mean) PDCP SDU delay on the downlink within the gNB-CU-UP for all PDCP packets. Sum of (time when sending a PDCP SDU to the gNB-DU at the egress PDCP layer on F1-U/Xn-U, minus time of arrival of the same packet at NG-U ingress IP termination) divided by total number of PDCP SDUs arriving at NG-U ingress IP termination

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

{
    "PmCounterReport": {
        "InstanceId": "<string>",
        "CounterId": "AVERAGE_DELAY_DL_IN_CUUP_QOS",
        "InstanceType": "NONE_TYPE",
        "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>",
        "CounterValue": "<uint32>", //Mean Delay in 0.1 millisecond
        "QFI": "<uint32>"
    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: CU Packet Delay: Average delay DL in CU-UP (S-NSSAI)
docs.text:
Description : The average (arithmetic mean) PDCP SDU delay on the downlink within the gNB-CU-UP for all PDCP packets. Sum of (time when sending a PDCP SDU to the gNB-DU at the egress PDCP layer on F1-U/Xn-U, minus time of arrival of the same packet at NG-U ingress IP termination) divided by total number of PDCP SDUs arriving at NG-U ingress IP termination

        "SST": "<uint32>", // S-NSSAI SST

    },

}

docs.title: CU SS RSRP Distribution per SSB
docs.text:
Description : This measurement provides the distribution of SS-RSRP per SSB (see TS 38.215) received by gNB from UEs in the cell when SS-RSRP is used for L1-RSRP as configured by reporting configurations as defined in TS 38.214, in case the L1-RSRP report function is enabled.

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

Reported RSRP value (range 0..127) Measured quantity value (L1 SS-RSRP) Bin0 127 >= -30 dBm Bin1 126..107 -31 dBm to -50dBm Bin2 106..87 -51 dBm to -70dBm Bin3 86..67 -71 dBm to -90 dBm Bin4 66..47 -91 dBm to -110 dBm Bin5 46..27 -111 dBm to -130 dBm Bin6 26..7 -131 dBm to -150 dBm Bin7 6..0 <= -150 dBm 
{
    "PmCounterReport": {
        "InstanceId": "<string>", // ssb frequency
        "CounterId": "SS_RSRP_DISTRIBUTION_PER_SSB",
        "InstanceType": "SSB_FREQ_TYPE",
        "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>",
        "CounterValue": "<uint32>", // count
        "bin": "<uint32>", // bin
        "ssb": "<string>", //ssb frequency
    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: CU Packet Delay: Distribution of delay DL in CU-UP (QOS)
docs.text:
Description : The distribution of PDCP SDU delay on the downlink within the gNB-CU-UP, for all PDCP packets (time when sending a PDCP SDU to the gNB-DU at the egress PDCP layer on F1-U/Xn-U, minus time of arrival of the same packet at NG-U ingress IP termination) distributed in following bins

Kafka topic : accelleran.drax.5g.ric.processed.pm_counters

Bin Value bin0 <= 5ms bin1 6ms to 10ms bin2 11ms to 20ms bin3 21ms to 30ms .. bin10 91ms to 100ms bin11 101ms to 200ms bin12 201ms to 300ms .. bin19 901ms to 1000ms bin20 >1s to <=2s bin21 >2s to <=3s bin22 >3s to <=4s bin23 >4s to <=5s bin24 > 5s 
{
    "PmCounterReport": {
        "InstanceId": "<string>", // QFI
        "CounterId": "DISTRIBUTION_OF_DELAY_DL_IN_CUUP_QOS",
        "InstanceType": "QOS_TYPE",
        "ReportingNodeId": "<uint32>",
        "CounterValue": "<uint32>",
        "bin": "<uint32>",
        "QFI": "<string>"
    },
    "timestamp": <uint64>
}

docs.title: E1LinkPolicy
docs.text:
Groups parameters that define the policy relating to the use of E1 links.

Field Type Label Description SctpPolicy SctpPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy for the use of SCTP on E1 links.

docs.title: F1CLinkPolicy
docs.text:
Groups parameters that define the policy relating to the use of F1-c links.

Field Type Label Description SctpPolicy SctpPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy for the use of SCTP on F1-c links.

docs.title: NgCLinkPolicy
docs.text:
Groups parameters that define the policy relating to the use of NG-C links.

Field Type Label Description SctpPolicy SctpPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy for the use of SCTP on NG-C links.

docs.title: NrCellGlobalIdentity
docs.text: Field Type Label Description PlmnIdentity string optional NrCellIdentity uint64 optional

docs.title: ReportPollingConfig
docs.text: Field Type Label Description TimerEnabled bool optional PduWithoutPollCountEnabled bool optional Timer uint32 optional NumPduWithoutPoll uint32 optional

docs.title: SNssai
docs.text: Field Type Label Description Sst Sst optional Slice/Service Type. Sd uint32 optional Slice Differentiator.

docs.title: SctpPolicy
docs.text: Field Type Label Description InStreams uint32 optional The maximum number of inbound streams that will be accepted. OutStreams uint32 optional The number of outbound streams that will be requested.

docs.title: SsbMtc
docs.text: Field Type Label Description SmtcPeriodicity SsbMtcPeriodicity optional SmtcOffset uint32 optional SSB transmission offset in subframes Duration uint32 optional

docs.title: SupportedPlmnSlices
docs.text:
Groups information about a PLMN and the set of slices supported by that PLMN.

Field Type Label Description PlmnId string optional Identifies a PLMN. NbrOfSNssai uint32 optional automatically added field for "s-nssai" list SNssai SNssai repeated Identifies a slice that is supported by the PLMN.

docs.title: CellReselectionSubPriority
docs.text:
indicates a fractional value to be added to the value of cellReselectionPriority to obtain the absolute priority of the concerned carrier frequency for E-UTRA and NR

Name Number Description o_2 0 0.2 o_4 1 0.4 o_6 2 0.6 o_8 3 0.8

docs.title: CipheringAlgorithm
docs.text:
Type definition for 5G ciphering algorithms.

Name Number Description nea0 0 NEA0, the null 5G ciphering algorithm. nea1 1 128-NEA1, the 128-bit SNOW 3G based 5G ciphering algorithm. nea2 2 128-NEA2, the 128-bit AES based 5G ciphering algorithm. nea3 3 128-NEA3, the 128-bit ZUC based 5G ciphering algorithm.

docs.title: EutraAllowedMeasurementBandwidth
docs.text:
The values mbw6, mbw15, mbw25, mbw50, mbw75, mbw100 indicate 6, 15, 25, 50, 75 and 100 resource blocks, respectively

Name Number Description mbw6 0 mbw15 1 mbw25 2 mbw50 3 mbw75 4 mbw100 5

docs.title: FilterCoefficient
docs.text:
Allowed values for filtering coefficient

Name Number Description filter_coefficient_unknown 0 filter_coefficient_0 1 filter_coefficient_1 2 filter_coefficient_2 3 filter_coefficient_3 4 filter_coefficient_4 5 filter_coefficient_5 6 filter_coefficient_6 7 filter_coefficient_7 8 filter_coefficient_8 9 filter_coefficient_9 10 filter_coefficient_11 11 filter_coefficient_13 12 filter_coefficient_15 13 filter_coefficient_17 14 filter_coefficient_19 15

docs.title: IntegrityAlgorithm
docs.text:
Type definition for 5G integrity algorithms.

Name Number Description nia0 0 NIA0, the null 5G integrity algorithm. nia1 1 128-NIA1, the 128-bit SNOW 3G based 5G integrity algorithm. nia2 2 128-NIA2, the 128-bit AES based 5G integrity algorithm. nia3 3 128-NIA3, the 128-bit ZUC based 5G integrity algorithm.

docs.title: NrDuplexMode
docs.text:
Indicates the duplex-mode of a cell

Name Number Description fdd 0 Frequency division duplexing tdd 1 Time division duplexing

docs.text:
Slice/Service Type.

Name Number Description embb 0 Enhanced mobile broadband. urllc 1 Ultra-reliable low latency communications. miot 2 Massive IoT (Internet of Things). v2x 3 Vehicle-to-everything.

docs.title: TEvaluation
docs.text:
The duration for evaluating criteria to enter mobility states. Corresponds to TCRmax in 3GPP TS 38.304. Value in seconds, s30 corresponds to 30 s and so on.

Name Number Description te_sf30 0 te_sf60 1 te_sf120 2 te_sf180 3 te_sf240 4 te_spare3 5 te_spare2 6 te_spare1 7

docs.title: THystNormal
docs.text:
The additional duration for evaluating criteria to enter normal mobility state. Corresponds to TCRmaxHyst in 3GPP TS 38.304. Value in seconds, value s30 corresponds to 30 seconds and so on.

Name Number Description thn_sf30 0 thn_sf60 1 thn_sf120 2 thn_sf180 3 thn_sf240 4 thn_spare3 5 thn_spare2 6 thn_spare1 7

docs.text: Field Type Label Description IpAddress string optional The destination IPv4 address to be used for an SCTP association. Port uint32 optional The destination port to be used for an SCTP association. InStreams uint32 optional The number of inbound SCTP streams the initiator will accept. OutStreams uint32 optional The number of outbound SCTP streams the initiator wishes to establish. The peer entity may respond indicating that the number of streams it can accept is lower.

docs.title: AdminState
docs.text:
Administrative state of a managed object. The value locked means that the managed object is not allowed to operate. The value ulocked means that the managed object is allowed to operate.

Name Number Description Locked 0 UnLocked 1

docs.title: AltitudeRef
docs.text: Name Number Description Wgs84 0 Altitude is with respect to the WGS-84 geoid MslGeoId 1 Altitude is with respect to the mean sea level geoid

docs.title: CellReserved
docs.text:
Indicates whether or not a cell is reserved for use by UEs belonging to Access Class 11 or 15.

Name Number Description Reserved 0 NotReserved 1

docs.title: OpState
docs.text:
Operational state of a managed object. The value enabled means that the managed object is capable of operating normally. The value disabled means that the managed object is not capable of operating normally (e.g. due to a fault condition).

Name Number Description Enabled 0 Disabled 1

docs.title: RfTxStatus
docs.text:
The RF transmit status of a cell. The value on-air means that the cell is transmitting and is able to provide service. The value off-air means that cell is not transmitting and is therefore not providing service.

Name Number Description OnAir 0 OffAir 1

docs.title: ExternalNrCellList
docs.text:
Contains a list of external neighbour relations, each containing a reference to a 5G NR external cell

Field Type Label Description NbrOfExternalNrCell uint32 optional automatically added field for "external-nr-cell" list ExternalNrCell ExternalNrNbrCell repeated Each entry in this list represents an external NR cell.

docs.title: ExternalNrNbrCell
docs.text: Field Type Label Description PlmnIdentity string optional NrCellIdentity uint64 optional NrGnbId uint32 optional GNB id for neighbour cell provided by dRax. NrGnbIdLength uint32 optional Number of valid bits for gNB Id provided by dRax. TargetTac uint32 optional TAC of the target cell cell PhysicalCellId uint32 optional The physical cell identity of the cell. Blacklisted bool optional True if the cell is to be included in the list of blacklisted cells for cell reselection purposes; otherwise false. SsbArfcn uint32 optional Absolute Radio Frequency(ARFCN) for the SS/PBCH block QOffsetCell PBAcc5GTypes.QOffsetRange optional QRxLevMinOffsetCell uint32 optional QRxLevMinOffsetCellSUL uint32 optional QQualMinOffsetCell uint32 optional SsbSubcarrierSpacing PBAcc5GTypes.SsbSubcarrierSpacing optional [3GPP 38.331] subcarrier spacing Smtc1 PBAcc5GTypes.SsbMtc optional FreqBandIndicator uint32 optional List of 5G frequency bands to perform measurements on.

docs.title: ReportConfigA3
docs.text:
Defines parameters that are configurable for all A3 report configurations (other than those in report-config-common).

Field Type Label Description A3Offset int32 optional The offset value to be used in an A3 report configuration. TriggerQuantity TriggerQuantity optional Indicates whether A3 is to be based on RSRP or RSRQ or SINR measurements. Hysteresis uint32 optional The hysteresis parameter used in the entering and leaving conditions for an A3 event triggered reporting condition. TimeToTrigger TimeToTrigger optional The time during which the conditions for an A3 event need to be met in order to trigger a measurement report.

docs.title: ReportConfigCommon
docs.text:
Defines parameters that are configurable for all reportConfigs.

Field Type Label Description MaxReportCells uint32 optional The maximum number of neighbour cells to be reported in the Measurement Report message. ReportInterval ReportInterval optional The interval between periodic reports. Can be applied to triggerType 'event' as well as 'periodical'. ReportAmount ReportAmount optional The number of measurement reports required. Can be applied to triggerType 'event' as well as 'periodical'. FilterCoeffRsrp PBAcc5GTypes.FilterCoefficient optional Filter coefficient for RSRP measurements at the UE FilterCoeffRsrq PBAcc5GTypes.FilterCoefficient optional Filter coefficient for RSRQ measurements at the UE FilterCoeffSinr PBAcc5GTypes.FilterCoefficient optional Filter coefficient for SINR measurements at the UE

docs.title: RegistrationRequestObject
docs.text: Field Type Label Description UserId string optional The UR-ID per [n.12] R2-SRR-02 conformant per section 2.2 of [n.18]. FccId string optional The FCC certification identifier of the CBSD. It is a string of up to 19 characters as described in [n.22] CbsdSerialNumber string optional A serial number assigned to the CBSD by the CBSD device manufacturer having a maximum length of 64 octets. This serial number shall be unique for every CBSD instance sharing the same value of fccId. Each CBSD has a single CBSD Antenna (Ref. definition in section 4) and has a single cbsdSerialNumber. CallSign string optional A device identifier provided by the FCC per [n.13]. CbsdCategory CbsdCategory optional Device Category of the CBSD. Allowed values are 'A' or 'B' as defined in Part 96 CbsdInfo CbsdInfo optional Information about this CBSD model. AirInterface AirInterfaceObject optional A data object that includes information on the air interface technology of the CBSD. InstallationParam InstallationParamObject optional A data object that includes information on CBSD installation. MeasurementCapabilities MeasurementCapabilitiesObject optional The array of string lists measurement reporting capabilities of the CBSD. The permitted enumerations are specified in [n.21]. GroupingParam GroupingParam optional An array of data objects that includes information on CBSD grouping. CpiSignatureData CpiSignatureData optional The CPI is vouching for the parameters included in this object. In addition, the digital signature for these parameters is included.

docs.text: Field Type Label Description MaxRegegistrationAttempts uint32 optional maximum number of registration attempts before entering fatal state MaxSpectrumInquiryAttempts uint32 optional maximum number of spectrum inquiry attempts before entering fatal state MaxRelinquishmentAttempts uint32 optional maximum number of relinquishment attempts before entering fatal state MaxDeregistrationAttempts uint32 optional maximum number of deregistration attempts before entering fatal state

docs.title: CbrsClientTimersConfig
docs.text: Field Type Label Description SpectrumInfoExpiration uint32 optional Time in seconds a Spectrum inquiry response is valid. If not set or if zero it is valid for ever NoAvailbleChannelsRetry uint32 optional Time in seconds a Spectrum inquiry will to send out a new request if the latest response did not return channels DeregistrationTimeout uint32 optional Time in seconds a deregistration procedure can last RelinquishmentTimeout uint32 optional Time in seconds a relinquishment procedure can last RegistrationPendingRetry uint32 optional Time in seconds we will wait before we retry registration request after receing a reg_pending response SpectrumInquiryRetry uint32 optional Time in seconds we will wait before we retry spectrum inquiry request after receiving a server error HttpTimeout uint32 optional Time in seconds an HTTP request can last

docs.title: PduSessionCreateInfo
docs.text:
Contains information to create/delete a GTP tunnel for benchmark puropses

Field Type Label Description PduSessionId uint32 optional The PDU Session will be created. Currently a PDU session can have only 1 tunnel TunnelId uint32 optional The tunnelId that will be created. Please not that MSB (most significant bit of the tunnel-id MUST be 0. It will be ignored anyway SimulatedDuIpAddress string optional The IPv4 address in dotted notation of the process that simulates the DU (downlink) SimulatedUpfIpAddress string optional The IPv4 address in dotted notation of the process that simulates the UPS (uplink)

docs.title: PduSessionTeardownInfo
docs.text:
Contains information to create/delete a GTP tunnel for benchmark puropses

Field Type Label Description PduSessionId uint32 optional The pduSessionId that will be deleted. TunnelId uint32 optional The tunnelId that will be deleted. Please not that MSB (most significant bit of the tunnel-id MUST be 0. It will be ignored anyway

docs.title: FilterModeType
docs.text:
Specifies how you want filterinf done

Name Number Description Filter_PREFIX 0 If the XPATH matches the beginning the filter will pass Filter_FULL 1 The XPATH must match exactly in order to pass Filter_LEAF 2 The XPATH must match exactly and the leaf must be matching in order to pass Filter_PREFIX_IGNORE_KEYS 3 If the XPATH matches the beginning the filter will pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes) Filter_FULL_IGNORE_KEYS 4 The XPATH must match exactly in order to pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes) Filter_LEAF_IGNORE_KEYS 5 The XPATH must match exactly and the leaf must be matching in order to pass (after the path was cleaned of keys attributes)

docs.title: Operation
docs.text:
Specifies what happend (Create Update Delete)

Name Number Description Operation_UNKNOWN 0 The operation could not be determined Operation_CREATE 1 A create was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_UPDATE 2 An update was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_DELETE 3 A delete was done for the given xpath/leaf Operation_ALL 4 value to indicate that all operations are good

docs.title: Origin
docs.text:
Specifies where the modification came from

Name Number Description Origin_APP 0 Modification was done by the application Origin_NETCONF 1 Modification was done via Netconf

docs.title: AdmissionControl
docs.text:
Contains the configuration for RIC based UE/PDU session admission control

Field Type Label Description RicUeAdmissionControlEnabled bool optional Send a message to the RIC to ask it for permission to admit a UE and wait for the response RicPduAdmissionControlEnabled bool optional Send a message to the RIC to ask it for permission to admit a PDU and wait for the response

docs.title: GnbCuCp
docs.text:
Grouping for the class representing a gNB-CU-CP.

Field Type Label Description GnbId uint32 optional The gNB ID part of the Global gNB ID. PlmnId string optional 5 or 6 digit PLMN code (MCC and MNC) of the PLMN to which the gNB belongs. Forms part of the gNB's Global gNB ID as used in NGAP messages. GnbIdLength uint32 optional The length of the bit string representation of the gNB ID. GnbCuCpName string optional Human readable name of the gNB-CU-CP. If configured, this is sent to a gNB-CU-UP, gNB-DU and AMF during the E1, F1 and NG Setup procedures respectively. AdminState PBAccGenTypes.AdminState optional Administrative state. Value 'unlocked' means that the gNB is permitted to serve users. Value 'locked' means that the gNB is prohibited from serving users. In the 'locked' state, all of the gNB's cells will be off air. RlcMode PBAcc5GTypes.RlcMode optional Contains RLC mode entity value. OpState PBAccGenTypes.OpState optional Operational state. Value 'disabled' means that the gNB is totally inoperable and unable to provide service to users. Value 'enabled' means that the gNB is partially or fully operable and available for use. NbrOfAllowedCipheringAlgorithm uint32 optional automatically added field for "allowed-ciphering-algorithm" list AllowedCipheringAlgorithm PBAcc5GTypes.CipheringAlgorithm repeated List of 5G ciphering algorithms allowed to be used in the gNB, in decreasing order of preference, i.e. most preferred algorithm first. If nea0 is included, it should be the last entry in the list. Ciphering algorithms that are not supported by the gNB must not be included in the list. NbrOfAllowedIntegrityAlgorithm uint32 optional automatically added field for "allowed-integrity-algorithm" list AllowedIntegrityAlgorithm PBAcc5GTypes.IntegrityAlgorithm repeated List of 5G integrity algorithms allowed to be used in the gNB, in decreasing order of preference, i.e. most preferred algorithm first. nia0 should only be included in deployments where support of unauthenticated emergency calling is a regulatory requirement, and should be the last entry in the list. Integrity algorithms that are not supported by the gNB must not be included in the list. E1LinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.E1LinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of SCTP on E1 interfaces. F1CLinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.F1CLinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of SCTP on F1-c interfaces. NbrOfOperator uint32 optional automatically added field for "operator" list Operator Operator repeated Data relating to an operator who makes use of the gNB's services and resources. There may be more than one operator in the case of RAN sharing.

docs.title: HandoverControl
docs.text:
Contains the configuration for RSRP triggered A3 events used for handover control

Field Type Label Description Enabled bool optional Controls if the gNB-CU-CP configures measurement reports for handover and triggers handovers based on them. This does not affect the ability to trigger handover through external handover commands. ReportConfigA3Rsrp PBAccNrUeMeas.ReportConfigA3 optional

docs.title: NgCLink
docs.text:
Grouping for the class representing an NG-C link.

Field Type Label Description DestAddress string optional IP address or FQDN of the AMF at the far end of the link. OpState PBAccGenTypes.OpState optional Value 'enabled' means that an SCTP association has been established and an NG Setup procedure has been successfully performed with the AMF at the far end of the link; otherwise the value is 'disabled'. DefaultAmf bool optional Corresponds to default AMF as specified in [3GPP 23.501] AmfName string optional This is the value of the AMF Name received in an NGAP message from the AMF at the far end of the link.

docs.title: Operator
docs.text:
Grouping for the class representing an operator of a gNB.

Field Type Label Description OperatorId string optional A string that uniquely identifies the operator. NgCLinkPolicy PBAcc5GTypes.NgCLinkPolicy optional Contains parameters that define the policy relating to the use of NG-C links to AMFs belonging to the operator. NbrOfNgCLink uint32 optional automatically added field for "ng-c-link" list NgCLink NgCLink repeated Represents a logical link on the NG-C interface between the gNB-CU-CP and an AMF.

docs.title: GnbCuUp
docs.text:
Represents a gNB-CU-UP.

Field Type Label Description UpIntegrityProtectionEnabled bool optional Value true means that the CU-UP will activate integrity protection of DRBs if requested, subject to the specified integrity algorithm being supported; false means that it will not activate integrity protection of DRBs under any circumstances. This determines how the CU-UP handles receipt of a Security Indication IE with the Integrity Protection Indication IE set to 'required' or 'preferred', over E1. UpCipheringEnabled bool optional Value true means that the CU-UP will activate confidentiality protection of DRBs if requested, subject to the specified ciphering algorithm being supported; false means that it will not activate confidentiality protection of DRBs under any circumstances. This determines how the CU-UP handles receipt of a Security Indication IE with the Confidentiality Protection Indication IE set to 'required' or 'preferred', over E1.

Name Number Description NONE_TYPE 0 included information is per complete node CELL_TYPE 1 included information is per cell AMF_TYPE 2 included information is per AMF (5G cores) UE_TYPE 3 included information is per UE UE_QOS_SNSSAI_PLMN_TYPE 4 included information is per UE, QFI, S-NSSAI and PLMN-ID SSB_FREQ_TYPE 5 included information is per SSB frequency QOS_TYPE 6 included information is per QoS SNSSAI_TYPE 7 included information is per S-NSSAI QOS_SNSSAI_PLMN_TYPE 8 included information is per QFI, S-NSSAI and PLMN-ID FIVEQI_TYPE 9 included information is per 5QI INVALID_TYPE 10

docs.text: .proto Type Notes C++ Java Python Go C# PHP Ruby  double double double float float64 double float Float  float float float float float32 float float Float  int32 Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers – if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead. int32 int int int32 int integer Bignum or Fixnum (as required)  int64 Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers – if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead. int64 long int/long int64 long integer/string Bignum  uint32 Uses variable-length encoding. uint32 int int/long uint32 uint integer Bignum or Fixnum (as required)  uint64 Uses variable-length encoding. uint64 long int/long uint64 ulong integer/string Bignum or Fixnum (as required)  sint32 Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s. int32 int int int32 int integer Bignum or Fixnum (as required)  sint64 Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s. int64 long int/long int64 long integer/string Bignum  fixed32 Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28. uint32 int int uint32 uint integer Bignum or Fixnum (as required)  fixed64 Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56. uint64 long int/long uint64 ulong integer/string Bignum  sfixed32 Always four bytes. int32 int int int32 int integer Bignum or Fixnum (as required)  sfixed64 Always eight bytes. int64 long int/long int64 long integer/string Bignum  bool bool boolean boolean bool bool boolean TrueClass/FalseClass  string A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text. string String str/unicode string string string String (UTF-8)  bytes May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes. string ByteString str []byte ByteString string String (ASCII-8BIT)

docs.title: Kafka
docs.text:
In this section we detail the messages that are produced by the Accelleran DU and exposed on the dRAX Databus.

[!WARNING]

THIS IS A PREVIEW OF THE ACCELLERAN DU MESSAGES

THIS IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE
